availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky, attorney. Nelson County, Virginia native. Attended the University of Virginia. Married to Amanda M. Graham Loving on January 6, 1829. Father of Hector V. Loving, John A. Loving, and Laura Loving. Admitted to the bar in 1829. Served in the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1840. Served in the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1841 to 1844. Commonwealth's Attorney for the Sixth Judicial District from 1845 to 1849. Circuit Judge for the Sixth Judicial District from 1849 to 1850. Attorney in Bowling Green in 1860.

ab.bibl: M. Secrist, Warren County, Kentucky: History Revealed Through Biographical and Genealogical Sketches of Its Ancestors (n.p.: Lulu Press, Inc, 2013). The Biographical Encyclop√¶dia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J. M. Armstrong and Company, 1878), p. 279. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, District 1, p. 150. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 91.
